channel.title: Recording HDMI?
channel.description:
I was just wondering what I would need to record HDMI output (from for example a HD dvd player, or an XBOX/PS3) and have it on a disc/hard drive in an editable format (AVI, MPEG, MP4 etc...)
Thanks from yo brother ma niggaz.... yeh!

item.title: Recording HDMI?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It was specifically made to stop you from recording it, because heaven forbid you make a video of you playing a game you own, on a console you own hooked up to a TV you own by a cable you own, right? I mean, it would be bad if you could record that…

Anyway, I’m sure someone has figured out a way, as lawl said the most you should need would be an HDMI input on your PC and a way to play it there.

Read full topic

item.title: Recording HDMI?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

theres nothing that could prevent you from copying it if you use a tuner/video input thing on pc

Read full topic

item.title: Recording HDMI?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I’m probably completely wrong here, but IIRC HDMI has some anti-copy thing across the cable called HDCP(High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection) which stops you from doing exactly that.

Read full topic
